intro: Noccaea camlikensis, commonly known as the Camlik's knotweed, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its hairy, leafy stems. It typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
